Package view.controller

Class DashboardViewController

java.lang.Object
view.ViewController
view.controller.DashboardViewController
public class DashboardViewController extends ViewController
contains the view controller components related to the dashboard

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    protected void
    init()
    called by the view handler when creating the view for the first time fetches the viewModel corresponding to this view binds the FXML variables to the property variables from the viewModel starts the view update thread in the viewModel (used to update the time, date and day of the week elements from this view) performs a viewModel reset so that all the appropriate data from the model is fetched just before the user is able to see it
    void
    onInventoryButtonPressed()
    handles the inventory button pressing event by sending displaying a window containing a list of items with three corresponding buttons for each item with the following functionality: - 'Edit Amount' button: displays a Text Input Dialog with a text field input with the default value of the number of items available at the moment in the store; after the user enters a number and presses ok, the number is passed to the viewModel in a corresponding function.
    void
    onLogoutButtonPressed()
    handles the logout button pressing event by sending a logout signal to the viewModel and opens the start view
    void
    onSettingsButtonPressed()
    handles the settings button pressing event by opening the settings view
    void
    reset()
    used to perform a reset into the viewModel, to update the data to the newest available version from the model

    Methods inherited from class view.ViewController

    getRoot, getViewHandler, getViewModelFactory, init

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • init

      protected void init()
      called by the view handler when creating the view for the first time fetches the viewModel corresponding to this view binds the FXML variables to the property variables from the viewModel starts the view update thread in the viewModel (used to update the time, date and day of the week elements from this view) performs a viewModel reset so that all the appropriate data from the model is fetched just before the user is able to see it
      Specified by:
      init in class ViewController

    • reset

      public void reset()
      used to perform a reset into the viewModel, to update the data to the newest available version from the model
      Specified by:
      reset in class ViewController

    • onLogoutButtonPressed

      public void onLogoutButtonPressed()
      handles the logout button pressing event by sending a logout signal to the viewModel and opens the start view

    • onInventoryButtonPressed

      public void onInventoryButtonPressed()
      handles the inventory button pressing event by sending displaying a window containing a list of items with three corresponding buttons for each item with the following functionality: - 'Edit Amount' button: displays a Text Input Dialog with a text field input with the default value of the number of items available at the moment in the store; after the user enters a number and presses ok, the number is passed to the viewModel in a corresponding function. if the inputted text is not a number or contains spaces, display an alert box stating the error and let the user try again - 'Edit Price' button: displays a Text Input Dialog with a text field input with the default value of the current price of the item; after the user enters a number and presses ok, the number is passed to the viewModel in a corresponding function. if the inputted text is not a number or contains spaces, display an alert box stating the error and let the user try again - 'Remove Item' button: displays a Confirmation Dialog stating that the item will be removed if the user presses 'YES' and it won't be removed if the user presses 'NO'

    • onSettingsButtonPressed

      public void onSettingsButtonPressed()
      handles the settings button pressing event by opening the settings view
